DUT.Table: CREATE TABLE DUTs ( Id TEXT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL, Name TEXT, Description TEXT, CreateTime DATETIME, ImagePath TEXT, ReportPath TEXT ); CREATE INDEX Id ON DUTs(Id);
DUT.Insert: INSERT INTO DUTs ( Id, Name, Description, CreateTime, ImagePath, ReportPath ) Values ( @Id, @Name, @Description, @CreateTime, @ImagePath, @ReportPath );
DUT.Update: UPDATE DUTs SET Id=@Id, Name=@Name, Description=@Description, CreateTime=@CreateTime, ImagePath=@ImagePath, ReportPath=@ReportPath;

Engineering.Table: CREATE TABLE Engineerings ( Number TEXT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL, CreateTime DATETIME, Description TEXT, Path TEXT, Commands ); CREATE INDEX Number ON Engineerings(Number);
Engineering.Insert: INSERT INTO Engineerings ( Number, CreateTime, Description, Path, Commands ) Values ( @Number, @CreateTime, @Description, @Path, @Commands );
Engineering.Update: UPDATE Engineerings SET Number=@Number, CreateTime=@CreateTime, Description=@Description, Path=@Path, Commands=@Commands;

MetricalData.Table: CREATE TABLE MetricalDatas ( Time DATETIME PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL, Data FLOAT, Flag TEXT, FuncValue FLOAT, Note TEXT ); CREATE INDEX Time ON MetricalDatas(Time);
MetricalData.Insert: INSERT INTO MetricalDatas ( Time, Data, Flag, FuncValue, Note ) Values ( @Time, @Data, @Flag, @FuncValue, @Note );
MetricalData.Update: UPDATE MetricalDatas SET Time=@Time, Data=@Data, Flag=@Flag, FuncValue=@FuncValue, Note=@Note;
